reviews.review_msg: the prof doesn't clarify assignments and the lack of class structure doesn't help. midterms requires an extraordinary amount of time and work and they don't really test your knowledge. the prof didn't teach anything but merely offered her opinions. she wants dialogue but if she doesn't agree with yours opinion she called you out on it. big ego.

She was an instructor with great interest in the class and enjoyed what she was teaching. Class attendance is MANDATORY. She, however, was a terrible instructor. She was unclear on midterm criteria causing a quarter of the class to do poorly. The midterm was also A LOT of work. Don't be fooled, this is NOT an easy credit, unless she favors you.

Great teacher if you're taking her for an elective.  Knows quite a bit about aboriginal cultures and spends the majority of the time discussing them.  However, don't take her if you're expecting an arch professor.  She isn't.
This class could be good or bad depends on how lucky you are in getting your assignments marked by nice or bad Ta. Some TAs you just have to avoid at all cost… Good luck!
You can see its quality by the introduction video.

I had to reschedule a quiz and she was very understanding so that was a plus. The course itself had a lot of material, and the quizzes were a bit tough, but overall not bad. Biggest downside was the project was graded unfairly i feel like but oh well. Overall nothing crazy.

quizzes full of spelling mistakes, asking the most random questions based on readings and videos that were either optional or like super random and specific.
TA's some of the worst i've ever dealt with.
horribly organized class and completely ruined art history for me :) thanks.

ABSOLUTELY AVOID. The quizzes are ridiculously tough and vague, doing well is nearly impossible. She pulls questions from random timestamps in lecture videos and expects you to recognize random images from slides—there are over 100 slides per module, and she usually tests on three. Save yourself the stress and take something else.

She replaced some of the original course videos with her videos. These new videos are about her opinions and nothing worth of remembering. She does not look at anything you submit, despite what she says in the videos and emails. The quizzes are filled with braindead questions like asking what some random nobody was doing in a YouTube video.

She basically used all of David Maxwells lectures and quizzes and didnt teach at all. She made two modules and they were mostly just rambles. She told us the quiz questions were "just images" but that wasn't the case as they expected you to know way too much info. Easy B, but hard to get better than that unless you are very into archaeology.
Lame professor for many reasons teaching a lazy class. So many errors throughout with unclear marking. Also, we were promised a scale/extra points and they were never given. Avoid.

4 image quizzes for 15% that were riddled with spelling errors and misleading images. The PowerPoint project was very easy to get a high grade on which was nice. However, the overall structuring of the course and guidance leaves a lot to be desired. It's not a GPA booster, but not hard to get a decent mark.

quizzes had massive issues (one gave 10 extra questions resulting in 40 questions in 30 minutes) and students suffered prof mistakes greatly as a result. Its passable but dont take this course if you want a good grade because she will trick you on quizzes by misspelling answers and having images throw you off from what the question is asking

If Prof Maxwell is teaching this course, then take it. But, if Laurie is the instructor along with her two mean TAs, Deanna and Melissa, AVOID this class. They do not want their students to succeed and refuse to review assignments for reevaluation. Also, they provide unclear instructions and unfairly deduct points for their own miscommunications.

I took this class after enjoying one of Prof.Maxwell's lectures and enjoying the topics. This was the opposite experience. Ignorant and egotistical TAs, with Laurie being no different and having little to no care for students taking the course. Lecture vids by Maxwell were good, but modules made by Laurie had no relevance to the course topic

HORRIBLE!! Do NOT take this class with this professor and TAs. The class was unprofessional, with no interest in student success. They refused to re-evaluate assignments, even when returned on the last day of the term, claiming students should "learn from their mistakes." That delay is their fault, not ours. They have ZERO empathy whatsoever.

No matter what anyone else says about her ARCH 301, don't take it. 
Laurie is just lazy and lets TAs "solve" everything. Whereas TAs will straight-up disregard you.
The grading criteria are clear, but the grading is NOT. The TAs will deduct marks and leave abstract comments, which shows how little care they put into evaluating your assignment.

The grading consisted primarily of 4 quizzes and one assignment. Quizzes were extremely in depth and required you to have a detailed understanding of all the required and suggested materials. Definitely the most demanding test/quizzes I've taken, I would expect most students thought these were unfair.

She replaced some of the original course videos with her videos. These new videos are about her opinions and nothing worth of remembering. She does not look at anything you submit, despite what she says in the videos and emails. The quizzes are filled with braindead questions like asking what some random nobody was doing in a YouTube video.

This class is NOT a GPA booster. The prof does nothing except send a few emails here and there (the lectures are recorded by another prof, quizzes are auto-graded and assignments are marked by TAs). The 4 "image" quizzes are very misleading as the image has nothing to do with the question. TAs also mark very harshly for no valid reason.
